definition[0]: an agreement by a lender not to go above or below certain interest rates on a particular loan
example[0]: The mortgage lenders have introduced a cap and collar deal with an upper rate of 7.75% and a floor of 5.99%.
definition[1]: in a takeover, a maximum and minimum offer for shares
example[1]: Its bid for the company includes a cap and collar designed to give investors a fixed price and a greater sense of security.
